originContent: 中压塔中，上升气体与下降液体充分精馏和传热传质后，在中压塔顶部得到纯氮气。一股纯氮气进入中压塔顶部的主冷凝蒸发器E02冷凝成液氮，一股液氮作为中压塔的回流液，一股经过冷器后作为液氮产品送入液氮贮槽V50。另外一股纯氮气经主换热器E01复热后送出冷箱，一股作为原料气送入增压机C02增压。氮气被冷凝的同时，主冷凝蒸发器E02中的液氧得到气化。由于填料高度的限制，中压塔底部液体含氧量会增加，但无法达到产品纯度，只能送到上塔后完成精馏，再进入主冷凝蒸发器后成为纯液氧。根据组分的轻重不同，从中压塔中可抽出液氮和富氧液空，通过过冷器降温后进入低压塔。低压塔中，所有从中压塔送来的原料，经过再次精馏，分别产出常压氮气，污氮气和液氧。低压塔顶部抽出纯氮气，经过冷器和主换热器复热后被分为三股流：一股被输送到压缩机 C02 以进行进一步压缩，另一股作为氮气产品向下输送，第三股则用作冷箱密封气。污氮气出上塔后，经过冷器，主换热器加温后，送入分子筛系统作为再生气。
tranlastedContent: In the medium-pressure column, after thorough rectification and heat and mass transfer between rising gas and descending liquid, pure nitrogen is obtained at the top. A portion of this pure nitrogen enters the main condenser-reboiler (E02) at the top of the medium-pressure column, where it condenses into liquid nitrogen. One stream of this liquid nitrogen serves as reflux for the medium-pressure column, while another, after passing through a cooler, is sent as a liquid nitrogen product to the liquid nitrogen storage tank (V50). An additional stream of pure nitrogen is reheated by the main heat exchanger (E01) and exits the cold box; part of this stream is then fed as raw material to the booster (C02) for compression. As the nitrogen condenses, the liquid oxygen in the main condenser-reboiler (E02) vaporizes. Due to limitations in packing height, the oxygen content in the liquid at the bottom of the medium-pressure column increases, but it cannot reach product purity. This liquid must therefore be sent to the low-pressure column for further rectification, after which it enters the main condenser-reboiler to become pure liquid oxygen. Based on the different densities of the components, liquid nitrogen and oxygen-enriched liquid air can be drawn from the medium-pressure column and, after being cooled by an subcooler, enter the low-pressure column. In the low-pressure column, all the raw materials supplied from the medium-pressure column undergo a second rectification, producing atmospheric pressure nitrogen, waste nitrogen, and liquid oxygen. Pure nitrogen drawn from the top of the low-pressure column is reheated by a cooler and the main heat exchanger, then divided into three streams: one is sent to compressor C02 for further compression, another is dispatched as a nitrogen product, and the third is used as cold box sealing gas. After exiting the low-pressure column, the waste nitrogen passes through a cooler and is warmed by the main heat exchanger before being sent to the molecular sieve system as regeneration gas.

originContent: 压缩空气在分子筛系统出口作为中压塔原料气，在主换热器E01中吸收冷量后直接送入中压塔K01。中压塔顶部氮气和膨胀氮气经过冷器E03和主换热器E01复温与喂气机C50出口增压氮气，一共三路送入增压机C02中进一步压缩。出增压机C02后氮气分为二股，一股经膨胀机增压端ET03C和ET04C送入主换热器E01冷却分两股，一股送高压节流阀HV1536，送入中压塔K01，另一股送入低温膨胀机膨胀端ET04，膨胀后经主换热器E01复温回到增压机C02进口；第二股直接送入主换热器E01，冷却后送入高温膨胀机膨胀端ET03，膨胀后经主换热器E01复温回到增压机C02进口。除上述几股流体主换热器也回收冷量，冷量分别来自纯氮塔的常压氮气和低压塔的污氮气。过冷器E03的冷源为低压塔K02送出的污氮气，常压氮气及液氧，热源是来自低压塔K02的二股液体,分别为去粗氩冷凝器E10的富氧液空和去纯氮塔K03和精氩冷凝器E16的液氮。
tranlastedContent:
Compressed air leaving the molecular sieve system serves as the feed gas for the medium-pressure column. After being cooled in the main heat exchanger E01, it is directly fed into the medium-pressure column K01. Nitrogen from the top of the medium-pressure column and expanded nitrogen are reheated, first by subcooler E03 and then by the main heat exchanger E01. These two streams, along with the pressurized nitrogen exiting the feeder C50, form a total of three streams that are directed to the booster compressor C02 for further compression.

After exiting the booster compressor C02, the nitrogen stream divides into two main paths. The first path sees the nitrogen routed through the booster stages ET03C and ET04C of the expanders before being sent to the main heat exchanger E01 for cooling. Here, this stream further splits into two substreams: one is directed through the high-pressure throttle valve HV1536 and then into the medium-pressure column K01; the other is sent to the expansion stage ET04 of the low-temperature expander. After expanding, this latter substream is reheated by the main heat exchanger E01 and returns to the inlet of the booster compressor C02.

The second main nitrogen stream from the booster compressor C02 is sent directly to the main heat exchanger E01. After cooling, it proceeds to the expansion stage ET03 of the high-temperature expander. Post-expansion, this stream is also reheated by the main heat exchanger E01 and returns to the inlet of the booster compressor C02.

Beyond handling these various nitrogen flows, the main heat exchanger E01 also recovers cold energy from other sources. Specifically, this cold comes from atmospheric nitrogen produced by the pure nitrogen column and waste nitrogen from the low-pressure column.

The subcooler E03, meanwhile, draws its cooling power from waste nitrogen, atmospheric nitrogen, and liquid oxygen supplied by the low-pressure column K02. Its heat sources are two liquid streams originating from the low-pressure column K02: oxygen-rich liquid air destined for the crude argon condenser E10, and liquid nitrogen heading to both the pure nitrogen column K03 and the fine argon condenser E16.

originContent: 在低压塔中下部抽取一定量的氩馏分送入粗氩塔1段K10-1作为原料气，原料气在粗氩塔1段与回流液完成部分精馏后从粗氩塔1段塔顶抽出，送入粗氩塔2段K10-2与回流液精馏得到粗氩气。粗氩气一部分在粗氩塔冷凝器E10中与来自中压塔的富氧液空热交换，另一部分粗氩气进入精氩塔K11，在精氩塔中将剩余的氮组分通过低温精馏去除。冷凝后的粗氩液作为回流液与上升气进行精馏。粗氩塔2段K10-2底部的粗氩液经循环液氩泵P10A/B加压后送回粗氩塔1段K10-1顶部作为回流液。精氩塔顶部气体在精氩塔冷凝器E16中被来自中压塔的液氮液化，作为精氩塔回流液，余气放空，余气为精馏时去除的氮气和氩气的混合物。精氩塔底部的液氩在精氩塔蒸发器E15中被来自中压塔的氮气气化，为精氩塔提供上升气维持精馏。部分液氩在底部抽出，作为液氩产品送入贮槽。
tranlastedContent: From the middle-lower section of the low-pressure column, an argon fraction is drawn and fed into the first stage of the crude argon column (K10-1) as feed gas. After undergoing partial rectification with reflux liquid in crude argon column stage 1, this feed gas is withdrawn from the top of stage 1 and then sent to the second stage of the crude argon column (K10-2) for rectification with reflux liquid to produce crude argon gas. A portion of this crude argon gas exchanges heat with oxygen-enriched liquid air from the medium-pressure column in the crude argon column condenser (E10). The remaining crude argon gas enters the refined argon column (K11), where residual nitrogen components are removed through low-temperature rectification. The condensed crude argon liquid serves as reflux, undergoing rectification with the rising vapor. The crude argon liquid from the bottom of crude argon column stage 2 (K10-2) is pressurized by circulating liquid argon pumps (P10A/B) and then returned to the top of crude argon column stage 1 (K10-1) as reflux liquid. The gas from the top of the refined argon column is liquefied by liquid nitrogen from the medium-pressure column in the refined argon column condenser (E16), forming the reflux liquid for the refined argon column. The remaining gas, which is a mixture of nitrogen and argon removed during rectification, is vented. Liquid argon at the bottom of the refined argon column is vaporized by nitrogen gas from the medium-pressure column in the refined argon column evaporator (E15), providing the rising vapor necessary to sustain rectification. A portion of the liquid argon is withdrawn from the bottom as a liquid argon product and sent to a storage tank.

originContent: 中压塔中，上升气体与下降液体充分精馏和传热传质后，在中压塔顶部得到纯氮气。一股纯氮气进入中压塔顶部的主冷凝蒸发器E02冷凝成液氮，一股液氮作为中压塔的回流液，一股经过冷器后作为液氮产品送入液氮贮槽V50。另外一股纯氮气经主换热器E01复热后送出冷箱，一股作为原料气送入增压机C02增压。氮气被冷凝的同时，主冷凝蒸发器E02中的液氧得到气化。由于填料高度的限制，中压塔底部液体含氧量会增加，但无法达到产品纯度，只能送到上塔后完成精馏，再进入主冷凝蒸发器后成为纯液氧。根据组分的轻重不同，从中压塔中可抽出液氮和富氧液空，通过过冷器降温后进入低压塔。
tranlastedContent: Inside the medium-pressure column, pure nitrogen is obtained at the top after the rising gas and descending liquid undergo thorough rectification, heat, and mass transfer. A portion of this pure nitrogen flows into the main condenser-evaporator E02 at the top of the medium-pressure column, where it condenses into liquid nitrogen. One stream of this liquid nitrogen serves as the reflux for the medium-pressure column, while another, after passing through a subcooler, is sent as a liquid nitrogen product to the liquid nitrogen storage tank V50. Additionally, another stream of pure nitrogen is reheated by the main heat exchanger E01 and exits the cold box; a part of this is then fed into booster C02 as raw gas for pressurization. As the nitrogen condenses, the liquid oxygen within the main condenser-evaporator E02 simultaneously vaporizes. Due to limitations in packing height, the oxygen content in the liquid at the bottom of the medium-pressure column increases. However, it cannot achieve product purity there, so it must be sent to the upper column for complete rectification before entering the main condenser-evaporator to become pure liquid oxygen. Depending on the varying densities of their components, liquid nitrogen and oxygen-rich liquid air can be drawn from the medium-pressure column and then sent into the low-pressure column after being cooled by a subcooler.

originContent: 浙江省天正设计工程有限公司是一家以“提升化工企业的安全管理水平”为核心业务的综合性技术服务公司。公司致力于提升石油化工、精细化工、煤化工等高风险行业内企业的风险管控能力，在为客户创造价值的同时携手客户共同促进化工行业的可持续发展。公司通过引进国外先进的安全管理模式，结合当前国内企业现状，重塑了过程安全管理(PSM)的新理念，将安全管理变“被动响应”为“主动预防”，将过程安全管理的“各要素”与生产实际深度融合，辅助客户深刻理解、认识装置生命周期内的过程安全风险，持续提高过程安全风险管控能力和绩效水平。
tranlastedContent: Zhejiang Tianzheng Design Engineering Co., Ltd. is a comprehensive technical service company whose core business is "enhancing the safety management level of chemical enterprises." The company is dedicated to improving risk control capabilities for enterprises in high-risk industries such as petrochemical, fine chemical, and coal chemical sectors. While creating value for clients, we also partner with them to jointly promote the sustainable development of the chemical industry. By introducing advanced international safety management models and integrating them with the current situation of domestic enterprises, the company has redefined the philosophy of Process Safety Management (PSM). This transformation shifts safety management from "passive response" to "active prevention," seamlessly integrating the various elements of PSM with real-world production practices. This approach helps clients to thoroughly grasp and identify process safety risks throughout the facility's lifecycle, continuously enhancing their process safety risk management capabilities and performance.

originContent: 国家安全监管总局《加强化工过程安全管理的指导意见 》安监总管三〔2013〕88 号要求：对涉及重点监管危险化学品、重点监管危险化工工艺和危险化学品重大危险源（以下统称“两重点一重大”）的生产储存装置进行风险辨识分析，要采用危险与可操作性分析（HAZOP）技术，一般每 3 年进行一次。对其他生产储存装置的风险辨识分析，针对装置不同的复杂程度，选用安全检查表、工作危害分析、预危险性分析、故障类型和影响分析（FMEA）、HAZOP 技术等方法或多种方法组合，可每 5 年进行一次。
tranlastedContent: The State Administration of Work Safety (SAWS), in its "Guiding Opinions on Strengthening Chemical Process Safety Management" (Order No. 88 [2013]), mandates specific risk assessment procedures. For production and storage facilities involving hazardous chemicals under key supervision, hazardous chemical processes under key supervision, and major hazard sources of hazardous chemicals (collectively referred to as "Two Keys and One Major"), risk identification and analysis must utilize Hazard and Operability (HAZOP) studies, typically conducted every three years. For other production and storage facilities, risk identification and analysis can employ methods such as safety checklists, job hazard analysis, preliminary hazard analysis, failure mode and effects analysis (FMEA), HAZOP studies, or a combination of these, depending on the facility's complexity. These assessments may be conducted every five years.

originContent: 中压塔顶部氮气和膨胀氮气经过冷器E03和主换热器E01复温与喂气机C50出口增压氮气，一共三路送入增压机C02中进一步压缩。出增压机C02后氮气分为二股，一股经膨胀机增压端ET03C和ET04C送入主换热器E01冷却分两股，一股送高压节流阀HV1536，送入中压塔K01，另一股送入低温膨胀机膨胀端ET04，膨胀后经主换热器E01复温回到增压机C02进口；第二股直接送入主换热器E01，冷却后送入高温膨胀机膨胀端ET03，膨胀后经主换热器E01复温回到增压机C02进口。
tranlastedContent:
Three distinct streams of nitrogen converge for further compression: the nitrogen from the top of the medium pressure tower, expanded nitrogen — both of which have been re-warmed by cooler E03 and main heat exchanger E01 — and pressurized nitrogen exiting feed gas compressor C50. All three are directed into booster compressor C02.

After leaving booster compressor C02, this nitrogen divides into two main pathways. The first path sees the nitrogen routed through the boosting sections ET03C and ET04C of an expander before entering main heat exchanger E01 for cooling. Here, it splits again: one portion flows through high-pressure throttle valve HV1536 and into medium pressure tower K01, while the other portion is directed to the expansion end ET04 of the low-temperature expander. After expanding, this stream is re-warmed by main heat exchanger E01 before returning to the inlet of booster compressor C02. The second main nitrogen stream goes directly into main heat exchanger E01. After being cooled, it proceeds to the expansion end ET03 of the high-temperature expander. Following its expansion, this stream also gets re-warmed by main heat exchanger E01 before looping back to the inlet of booster compressor C02.

originContent: 在低压塔中下部抽取一定量的氩馏分送入粗氩塔1段K10-1作为原料气，原料气在粗氩塔1段与回流液完成部分精馏后从粗氩塔1段塔顶抽出，送入粗氩塔2段K10-2与回流液精馏得到粗氩气。粗氩气一部分在粗氩塔冷凝器E10中与来自中压塔的富氧液空热交换，另一部分粗氩气进入精氩塔K11，在精氩塔中将剩余的氮组分通过低温精馏去除。冷凝后的粗氩液作为回流液与上升气进行精馏。粗氩塔2段K10-2底部的粗氩液经循环液氩泵P10A/B加压后送回粗氩塔1段K10-1顶部作为回流液。
tranlastedContent: A specific quantity of argon fraction is drawn from the middle-lower section of the low-pressure tower and introduced into Section 1 (K10-1) of the crude argon tower as the raw material gas. After undergoing partial rectification with the reflux liquid in Section 1 of the crude argon tower, this raw material gas is withdrawn from the top of Section 1 and sent to Section 2 (K10-2) of the crude argon tower, where it undergoes further rectification with reflux liquid to yield crude argon gas. A portion of this crude argon gas then undergoes heat exchange with oxygen-rich liquid air from the medium-pressure tower within the crude argon tower condenser (E10). The remaining crude argon gas proceeds to the refined argon tower (K11), where any residual nitrogen components are removed through low-temperature rectification. The condensed crude argon liquid then serves as reflux liquid, undergoing rectification with the upward-flowing vapor. Finally, the crude argon liquid from the bottom of Section 2 (K10-2) of the crude argon tower is pressurized by the circulating liquid argon pumps (P10A/B) and returned to the top of Section 1 (K10-1) of the crude argon tower to act as reflux.

originContent: HAZOP分析报告是根据中国航空技术杭州有限公司提供的分析资料、在HAZOP分析会上补充的部分设计信息、以及HAZOP分析讨论内容编制、汇总而成，是整个HAZOP分析小组达成一致意见的结果。由于受到资料、参会人员经验限制等制约因素，可能存在一些被忽视或低估了的风险，需要通过装置或企业的工艺过程安全管理对潜在的各种风险进行持续地识别、评估和控制，以尽可能辨识工艺流程中潜在的危险源和可能存在的操作问题。
tranlastedContent: The HAZOP analysis report was compiled and summarized based on the analysis data provided by China Aviation Technology Hangzhou Co., Ltd., supplementary design information gathered during the HAZOP analysis meeting, and the discussions from the HAZOP analysis. It represents the unanimous consensus reached by the entire HAZOP analysis team. However, due to constraints such as limited available data and the experience levels of the attendees, some risks may have been overlooked or underestimated. Therefore, it is crucial for the plant or enterprise to continuously identify, evaluate, and control potential risks through robust process safety management. This ongoing effort aims to identify, to the greatest extent possible, all potential hazards and operational issues within the process.

originContent: 为了贯彻落实《中华人民共和国安全生产法》、《危险化学品安全管理条例》、《关于开展提升危险化学品领域本质安全水平专项行动的通知》安监总管三〔2012〕87号等有关法律法规的精神，贯彻“安全第一、预防为主、综合治理”的安全生产方针，实现建设项目的本质安全和生产，浙江省天正设计工程有限公司受中国航空技术杭州有限公司委托，作为第三方，负责对科威特180TPD空分项目进行HAZOP分析。
tranlastedContent: To ensure compliance with the spirit of laws and regulations such as the "Law of the People's Republic of China on Work Safety," the "Regulations on the Safety Management of Hazardous Chemicals," and the "Notice on Carrying Out Special Action to Improve Intrinsic Safety Level in Hazardous Chemicals Field" (SAWS [2012] No. 87), and to implement the work safety policy of "safety first, prioritizing prevention, and integrated management" aimed at achieving inherent safety in construction projects and their production, Zhejiang Tianzheng Design Engineering Co., Ltd. was entrusted by China National Aero-Technology Import & Export Hangzhou Co., Ltd. to act as a third party responsible for conducting a HAZOP analysis for the Kuwait 180TPD Air Separation Project.

originContent: 国家安全监管总局  住房城乡建设部《关于进一步加强危险化学品建设项目安全设计管理的通知》安监总管三〔2013〕76号要求：建设单位在建设项目设计合同中应主动要求设计单位对设计进行危险与可操作性（HAZOP）审查，并派遣有生产操作经验的人员参加审查，对HAZOP审查报告进行审核。涉及“两重点一重大”和首次工业化设计的建设项目，必须在基础设计阶段开展HAZOP分析。
tranlastedContent: The "Notice on Further Strengthening the Safety Design Management of Hazardous Chemical Construction Projects" (State Administration of Work Safety and Ministry of Housing and Urban-Rural Development, Document No. Anjian Zongguan San [2013] 76) stipulates that: Project owners should proactively require design units to conduct Hazard and Operability (HAZOP) reviews of designs within project design contracts. They must also assign personnel with production and operation experience to participate in these reviews and audit the resulting HAZOP review reports. For construction projects involving "two key points and one major" (critical facilities, hazardous operations, and major hazard installations) and those with first-time industrialization designs, HAZOP analysis must be carried out during the basic design stage.

originContent: 国家安全生产监督管理总局《关于加强化工安全仪表系统管理的指导意见》（安监总管三〔2014〕116号）要求：设计安全仪表系统之前要明确安全仪表系统过程安全要求、设计意图和依据。要通过过程危险分析（HAZOP分析），充分辨识危险与危险事件，科学确定必要的安全仪表功能，并根据国家法律法规和标准规范对安全风险进行评估（SIL定级），确定必要的风险降低要求。
tranlastedContent: The "Guiding Opinions on Strengthening Management of Chemical Safety Instrumented Systems" (Anjian Zongguan San [2014] No. 116), issued by China's State Administration of Work Safety, mandates that before designing Safety Instrumented Systems (SIS), their process safety requirements, design intent, and basis must be clearly defined. It further requires the use of Process Hazard Analysis (PHA), such as HAZOP studies, to thoroughly identify hazards and hazardous events. Based on this, necessary Safety Instrumented Functions (SIF) are to be scientifically determined. Additionally, safety risks must be assessed according to national laws, regulations, and standards (including Safety Integrity Level, or SIL, classification) to establish the required risk reduction targets.

originContent: 冷气机冷却后的空气进入切换使用的分子筛纯化器R01/R02，分子筛纯化器中装有氧化铝和分子筛，可去除空气中的二氧化碳、水分、乙炔及碳氢化合物等杂质。空气纯化系统由分子筛纯化器，电加热器E09A/B组成。分子筛纯化器一台工作，另一台再生，由来自上塔的污氮气加热至约160℃进行交替循环再生，纯化器的切换周期约9小时（单筒工作时间约4.5小时）。
tranlastedContent: After being cooled by a chiller, air flows into the R01/R02 molecular sieve purifiers, which operate in an alternating fashion. These purifiers are packed with alumina and molecular sieves, designed to scrub out impurities like carbon dioxide, moisture, acetylene, and various hydrocarbons from the air. The entire air purification system comprises these molecular sieve purifiers and the E09A/B electric heaters. While one purifier is actively working, the other undergoes regeneration, heated to approximately 160°C by a stream of waste nitrogen from the upper tower. This ensures a continuous, alternating regeneration cycle. Each purification bed operates for about 4.5 hours, making the total switching cycle for the purifiers roughly 9 hours.

originContent: 引导词-要素/特性组合在不同系统的分析中、在系统生命周期的不同阶段以及当用于不同的设计描述时可能会有不同的解释。有些组合在既定系统的分析中可能没有意义，应不予考虑。应明确并记录所有引导词-要素/特性组合的解释。如果某组合在设计中有多种解释，应列出所有解释。另一方面，有时会出现不同的组合具有相同的解释。在这种情况下，应进行适当的相互参考。
tranlastedContent: Guide word-element/characteristic combinations may be interpreted differently depending on the system being analyzed, the stage of the system's life cycle, and the specific design description they are applied to. Some combinations might be meaningless in the analysis of a particular system and should therefore be disregarded. It is crucial to clearly define and document the interpretations for all guide word-element/characteristic combinations. If a combination has multiple interpretations within a design, all of them should be listed. Conversely, it sometimes happens that different combinations share the same interpretation. In such cases, appropriate cross-referencing should be implemented.

originContent: 本HAZOP分析所提出的建议措施旨在降低已辨识出的风险或提高装置的可操作性，建议措施的采纳与执行由相关责任方负责。由于设计方案不符合法规和标准要求、安装/调试不合规、制造及质量问题、维护及操作不恰当、检维修作业不符合法规及管理要求，建议措施落实不到位、后续各种变更造成风险等级提高等原因造成的事故，与浙江省天正设计工程有限公司无关。
tranlastedContent: The recommended measures proposed by this HAZOP analysis aim to reduce identified risks or improve the operability of the facility. The adoption and implementation of these recommended measures are the responsibility of the relevant parties. Zhejiang Tianzheng Design Engineering Co., Ltd. bears no responsibility for accidents caused by reasons such as: design plans failing to comply with regulations and standard requirements, non-compliant installation/commissioning, manufacturing and quality issues, improper maintenance and operation, inspection and maintenance activities not meeting regulatory and management requirements, inadequate implementation of recommended measures, or subsequent changes leading to an increased risk level.

originContent: 本次HAZOP分析由中国航空技术杭州有限公司及浙江省天正设计工程有限公司有限公司相关人员共同分析讨论完成。在本次项目分析中重点对空气精馏，氮气、氧气等的流量、温度、压力、液位、泄漏、腐蚀等工况进行了分析讨论，列举了不同的事故场景，并对事故场景的严重性、可能性及已有保护措施等内容进行了分析。根据风险程度，提出了相应建议措施。
tranlastedContent: This HAZOP analysis was jointly conducted and completed through discussions by personnel from China National Aero-Technology Import & Export Hangzhou Co., Ltd. and Zhejiang Tianzheng Design Engineering Co., Ltd. During this project analysis, a particular focus was placed on analyzing and discussing operating conditions such as flow, temperature, pressure, liquid level, leakage, and corrosion within the air distillation, nitrogen, and oxygen systems. Various accident scenarios were outlined, and their severity, likelihood, and existing protective measures were thoroughly analyzed. Based on the assessed risk levels, appropriate mitigating recommendations were then proposed.

originContent: 分析通常由项目负责人启动。项目负责人应确定开展分析的时间，指派HAZOP主席，并提供开展分析必需的资源。由于法律规定或用户政策要求，通常在正常的项目计划期间已确定需要开展此类分析。在HAZOP主席的协助下，项目负责人应明确分析的范围和目标。分析开始前，项目负责人应指派具有适当权限的人负责确保分析得出的建议或措施得以执行。
tranlastedContent: The analysis is typically initiated by the project manager. The project manager is responsible for scheduling the analysis, appointing the HAZOP chairman, and providing the necessary resources for its execution. Often, the need for such an analysis is established during the regular project planning phase, either due to legal requirements or specific user policy demands. With the assistance of the HAZOP chairman, the project manager should clearly define the scope and objectives of the analysis. Before the analysis commences, the project manager must designate an individual with appropriate authority to ensure that all recommendations or actions resulting from the analysis are properly implemented.

originContent: f) 对于该引导词的其他解释，重复以上c)～e)过程：然后依次将其他引导词和要素的当前特性相结合，进行分析；接着对要素的每个特性重复 c)～e)过程(前提是对要素当前特性的分析达成了一致意见)；然后是对分析部分的每个要素重复b)～e)过程。一个部分分析完成后，应标记为“完成”。重复进行该过程，直到系统所有部分分析完毕。
tranlastedContent: f) For any other interpretations of this guiding term, repeat the process from c) to e). Then, one by one, combine other guiding terms with the current characteristics of the element to conduct the analysis. Following this, for each characteristic of the element, repeat the c) to e) process (provided that a consensus has been reached on the analysis of the element's current characteristics). Next, for each element within the part being analyzed, repeat the b) to e) process. Once the analysis of a particular section is completed, it should be marked as "Completed." This entire process is repeated until all parts of the system have been fully analyzed.

originContent: 低压塔中，所有从中压塔送来的原料，经过再次精馏，分别产出常压氮气，污氮气和液氧。低压塔顶部抽出纯氮气，经过冷器和主换热器复热后被分为三股流：一股被输送到压缩机 C02 以进行进一步压缩，另一股作为氮气产品向下输送，第三股则用作冷箱密封气。污氮气出上塔后，经过冷器，主换热器加温后，送入分子筛系统作为再生气。
tranlastedContent: In the low-pressure column, all raw materials fed from the medium-pressure column undergo further rectification, yielding atmospheric nitrogen, impure nitrogen, and liquid oxygen. Pure nitrogen is extracted from the top of the low-pressure column, and after being reheated by the cooler and the main heat exchanger, it is divided into three streams: one stream is sent to compressor C02 for further compression, another stream is sent downwards as a nitrogen product, and the third stream is used as cold box sealing gas. After the impure nitrogen exits the upper column, it is heated by the cooler and the main heat exchanger before being sent into the molecular sieve system as regeneration gas.

originContent: HAZOP主席：与设计小组和本工程项目没有紧密关系；在组织HAZOP分析方面受过训练，富有经验；负责HAZOP小组和项目管理人员之间的交流；制定分析计划；同意分析小组的人员构成；确保有足够的设计描述和资料提供给分析小组；建议分析中使用的引导词，并解释引导词-要素/特性，引导分析；确保分析结果的记录。
tranlastedContent: HAZOP Chairman: Has no close relationship with the design team or the project itself; is trained and experienced in organizing HAZOP analyses; is responsible for communication between the HAZOP team and project management personnel; develops the analysis plan; approves the composition of the analysis team; ensures sufficient design descriptions and data are provided to the analysis team; suggests the guide words to be used in the analysis, explains the guide word-parameter/characteristic combinations, and facilitates the analysis; ensures the recording of analysis results.

originContent: HAZOP的主要优势在于它是一种系统化、结构化且文档化的风险分析方法。为从HAZOP分析中得到最大效益，应做好分析结果记录、形成文档并做好后续管理跟踪。HAZOP主席负责确保每次会议均有适当的记录并形成文件。记录员应了解与HAZOP分析主题相关的技术知识，具备语言才能、良好的听力与关注细节的能力。
tranlastedContent: HAZOP's main strength lies in its nature as a systematic, structured, and documented risk analysis method. To maximize the benefits derived from a HAZOP analysis, it's crucial to thoroughly record the analysis results, generate comprehensive documentation, and ensure effective follow-up management. The HAZOP chairperson is responsible for ensuring that all meetings are properly recorded and documented. The recorder, in turn, needs to possess technical knowledge relevant to the HAZOP analysis topic, demonstrate strong linguistic abilities, exhibit excellent listening skills, and pay meticulous attention to detail.

originContent: 本项目在设计中已经采用了部分安全控制措施，经危险与可操作性（HAZOP）分析小组讨论，确定原有风险：很高风险0个，高风险9个，中风险122个，低风险0个；削减后风险：很高风险0个，高风险0个，中风险24个，低风险107个；采取建议措施后风险：很高风险0个，高风险0个，中风险15个，低风险116个。
tranlastedContent: During its design phase, this project had already incorporated some safety control measures. Following a detailed Hazard and Operability (HAZOP) analysis, the expert group identified the initial risk profile as: 0 very high risks, 9 high risks, 122 medium risks, and 0 low risks. After initial mitigation efforts, the risk levels were re-evaluated, showing: 0 very high risks, 0 high risks, 24 medium risks, and 107 low risks. Finally, after implementing the recommended measures, the risk assessment further improved to: 0 very high risks, 0 high risks, 15 medium risks, and 116 low risks.

originContent: 分子筛纯化器一台工作，另一台再生，由来自上塔的污氮气加热至约160℃进行交替循环再生，纯化器的切换周期约9小时（单筒工作时间约4.5小时）。当分子筛纯化器出口空气中CO2含量高报警，可通过缩短吸附周期调整，如果在调整吸附周期后仍然持续报警(非空气中CO2含量高导致)，可使用电加热器进行特殊再生。
tranlastedContent: Molecular sieve purifiers operate in a two-unit system: one unit is actively purifying while the other undergoes regeneration. This alternating regeneration cycle is driven by contaminated nitrogen gas, heated to approximately 160°C, originating from the upper tower. The total switching cycle for the purifier system is around 9 hours, meaning each individual unit operates for about 4.5 hours before switching. If a high CO2 content alarm is triggered in the air at the molecular sieve purifier's outlet, the issue can often be resolved by shortening the adsorption cycle. However, if the alarm persists even after adjusting the adsorption cycle (indicating the problem is not high CO2 content in the air itself), a special regeneration process using an electric heater can be employed.

originContent: 将选择的引导词与分析的要素或要素的特性相结合，检查其解释，以确定是否有合理的偏差。如果确定了一个有意义的偏差，则分析偏差发生的原因及后果。 有些应用中会发现，按照后果的潜在严重性或根据风险矩阵得到的相对风险等级对偏差进行分类是有用的。风险矩阵的使用在IEC 60300-3-9中有进一步论述。
tranlastedContent: Combine the selected guide words with the elements or characteristics of the elements being analyzed, and examine their interpretations to determine if there are any reasonable deviations. If a significant deviation is identified, analyze the causes and consequences of that deviation. In some applications, it can be useful to classify deviations according to the potential severity of their consequences or by the relative risk levels obtained from a risk matrix. The use of risk matrices is further discussed in IEC 60300-3-9.

originContent: 根据《危险与可操作性分析应用指南》（GBT 35320-2017）以及相关规范的要求，对本项目进行HAZOP分析。本报告展示了对中国航空技术杭州有限公司进行的HAZOP方法介绍及其分析结果，同时包括了为表明评审过程中的关注点所提出的建议，并将提出这些建议的原因详细地记录在HAZOP记录表中。
tranlastedContent: In accordance with the requirements of the *Hazard and Operability Analysis Application Guide* (GBT 35320-2017) and related specifications, a HAZOP analysis was conducted for this project. This report presents an introduction to the HAZOP methodology applied to China National Aero-Technology Import & Export Corporation Hangzhou Co., Ltd. and its analysis results. It also includes recommendations proposed to highlight concerns identified during the review process, with the reasons for these recommendations thoroughly documented in the HAZOP record table.

originContent: 公司技术实力丰富雄厚，创造性的整合了过程危害分析PHA、变更管理MOC、机械完整性MI、保护层分析LOPA、风险分级管控与隐患排查治理等安全管理的核心技术手段，采用“综合治理”、“协同共进”、“因地制宜”的新模式，使得安全管理真正可以落地生根，从而为客户提供切实可行的一体化解决方案。
tranlastedContent: The company boasts extensive and robust technical capabilities, having innovatively integrated core safety management methodologies such as Process Hazard Analysis (PHA), Management of Change (MOC), Mechanical Integrity (MI), Layers of Protection Analysis (LOPA), and tiered risk management alongside hazard identification and elimination. By adopting a new model encompassing "comprehensive governance," "collaborative advancement," and "context-specific implementation," we enable safety management to truly take root and flourish, thereby providing clients with practical and feasible integrated solutions.

originContent: 中国航空技术杭州有限公司  科威特180TPD空分项目 HAZOP分析报告  中国航空技术杭州有限公司  科威特180TPD空分项目 HAZOP分析报告  文件编号：PSM-PMC-2025072日期：2025年09月文件编号：PSM-PMC-2025072日期：2025年09月
tranlastedContent:
China Aviation Technology Hangzhou Co., Ltd. Kuwait 180TPD Air Separation Project HAZOP Analysis Report
文件编号：PSM-PMC-2025072日期：September 2025

originContent: b)“问题记录”只记录识别出的危险与可操作性问题以及后续行动。“问题记录”会使记录文件更容易管理。但是，这种记录方法不能彻底地记录分析过程，因此在审核时作用较小。 此外，在以后的某些研究中，还会再次进行相同的分析。因此，“问题记录”法是HAZOP记录的最低要求，使用时应谨慎。
tranlastedContent: b) The "Problem Record" only logs identified hazards, operability issues, and subsequent actions. While it makes managing documentation easier, this recording method does not comprehensively document the analysis process, making it less useful during audits. Furthermore, the same analysis may need to be repeated in future studies. Therefore, the "Problem Record" method represents the minimum requirement for HAZOP recording and should be used cautiously.

originContent: 国家安全生产监督管理总局：《关于进一步加强危险化学品企业安全生产标准化工作的指导意见》（安监总管三[2009]124号）中，提出“有关中央企业总部要组织所属企业积极开展重点化工生产装置危险与可操作性分析（HAZOP），全面查找和及时消除安全隐患，提高装置本质安全化水平。”
tranlastedContent: The State Administration of Work Safety (SAWS), in its "Guiding Opinions on Further Strengthening the Standardization of Work Safety in Hazardous Chemical Enterprises" (An Jian Zong Guan San [2009] No. 124), stipulated that: "The headquarters of relevant central enterprises must proactively organize their affiliated companies to conduct Hazard and Operability (HAZOP) analysis for critical chemical production units. The goal is to comprehensively identify and swiftly eliminate safety hazards, thereby elevating the inherent safety standards of these facilities."

originContent: HAZOP分析需要小组成员的共同努力，每个成员均有明确的分工。只要小组成员具有分析所需要的相关技术、操作技能以及经验，HAZOP小组应尽可能小。通常一个分析小组至少4人，很少超过7人。小组越大，进度越慢。当系统由承包商设计时，HAZOP小组应包括承包商和业主两方的人员。
tranlastedContent: HAZOP analysis requires collaborative effort from team members, with each member having a clear division of labor. The HAZOP team should be as small as possible, provided its members possess the relevant technical knowledge, operational skills, and experience necessary for the analysis. Typically, an analysis team consists of at least 4 people and rarely exceeds 7. The larger the team, the slower the progress. When a system is designed by a contractor, the HAZOP team should include personnel from both the contractor and the owner.

originContent: 国家安监总局《关于开展提升危险化学品领域本质安全水平专项行动的通知》安监总管三〔2012〕87号要求：对涉及“两重点一重大”（重点监管的危险化工工艺、重点监管的危险化学品及危险化学品重大危险源）危险化学品装置，应在项目基础设计阶段进行装置HAZOP分析。
tranlastedContent:
The State Administration of Work Safety (SAWS) issued the "Notice on Launching a Special Campaign to Enhance Intrinsic Safety Levels in the Hazardous Chemicals Sector" (SAWS [2012] No. 87), which mandates that hazardous chemical installations falling under the "Two Priorities and One Major Hazard" category—specifically, those involving key supervised hazardous chemical processes, key supervised hazardous chemicals, and major hazard sources of hazardous chemicals—must undergo HAZOP analysis during their basic design phase.
</step3_ref_translation>

originContent: HAZOP分析小组由中国航空技术杭州有限公司以及浙江省天正设计工程有限公司的不同专业的人员组成，由时东风担任主席于2025年09月09日在中国航空技术杭州有限公司的会议室进行了HAZOP分析，共1个工作日。HAZOP分析会议签到记录详见附录F。
tranlastedContent: The HAZOP analysis team, comprising personnel from different specialties at China Aviation Technology Hangzhou Co., Ltd. and Zhejiang Tianzheng Design Engineering Co., Ltd., conducted its analysis on September 09, 2025. Chaired by Shi Dongfeng, the analysis took place in the meeting room of China Aviation Technology Hangzhou Co., Ltd. and spanned a total of one working day. For a detailed attendance record of the HAZOP analysis meeting, please refer to Appendix F.

originContent: 安排HAZOP分析工作时，项目负责人应明确规定HAZOP小组的分工和职责，并得到HAZOP主席的同意。HAZOP主席应检查设计，确定可用的项目信息和HAZOP分析小组成员所需的技能。HAZOP主席应制定项目HAZOP活动计划，做好项目进度安排。
tranlastedContent: When organizing HAZOP analysis, the project leader should clearly define the HAZOP team's division of labor and responsibilities, subject to the HAZOP chairman's approval. The HAZOP chairman should review the design, identify available project information, and determine the necessary skills for HAZOP analysis team members. The HAZOP chairman should also develop the project's HAZOP activity plan and establish the project schedule.

originContent: 在HAZOP分析的计划阶段，HAZOP主席应提出要使用的引导词的初始清单。HAZOP主席应针对系统确认引导词的适宜性。应仔细考虑引导词的选择，如果引导词太具体可能会影响审查思路或讨论，如果引导词太笼统可能又无法有效地集中到HAZOP分析中。
tranlastedContent: During the planning stage of a HAZOP analysis, the HAZOP chairman should propose an initial list of guidewords to be used. The chairman should then confirm the suitability of these guidewords for the specific system under review. The selection of guidewords requires careful consideration: if they are too specific, they might restrict the review process or discussion, but if they are too general, they may fail to effectively focus the HAZOP analysis.

originContent: 中国航空技术杭州有限公司在HAZOP分析结束后，将负责对所有的建议进行响应，如果因任何原因导致建议不能实施，需要记录理由；对所接受的建议制定下一步行动计划，保证所有建议都落实。所有的理由和行动计划都应该存档以备今后工艺危害分析及风险管理。
tranlastedContent: Upon completion of the HAZOP analysis, China Aero Technology Hangzhou Co., Ltd. will be responsible for responding to all suggestions. If, for any reason, a suggestion cannot be implemented, the rationale must be documented. For all accepted suggestions, a next-step action plan will be developed to ensure their full implementation. All rationales and action plans should be archived for future process hazard analysis and risk management.

originContent: 国家安全生产监督管理总局（安监总危化第 255号文）《危险化学品建设项目安全评价细则（试行）》，第6.4.2.2条  ：对国内首次采用新技术、新工艺的建设项目的工艺安全性分析，除选择其它安全评价方法外，尽可能选择危险与可操作性研究法进行。
tranlastedContent: Article 6.4.2.2 of the "Detailed Rules for Safety Assessment of Hazardous Chemicals Construction Projects (Trial Implementation)," issued by the National Administration of Work Safety (Work Safety Supervision and Administration General Dangerous Chemicals Document No. 255), stipulates that for process safety analyses of construction projects introducing new technologies or processes for the first time in China, the Hazard and Operability (HAZOP) study method should be chosen whenever possible, in addition to other safety assessment techniques.

originContent: 在进行某一分析时，HAZOP主席及其HAZOP小组成员应决定选择“要素优先”还是“引导词优先”。HAZOP分析的习惯会影响分析顺序的选择。此外，影响这一决定的其他因素还包括：所涉及技术的性质、分析过程需要的灵活性以及小组成员接受过的培训。
tranlastedContent: When performing an analysis, the HAZOP chairman and their HAZOP team members must decide whether to prioritize "elements first" or "guidewords first." The established practices of HAZOP analysis influence the choice of this analysis sequence. Additionally, other factors affecting this decision include: the nature of the technology involved, the flexibility required by the analysis process, and the training received by team members.

originContent: HAZOP分析假设如下：
tranlastedContent: HAZOP analysis operates under the following assumptions:

originContent: HAZOP分析可接受风险
tranlastedContent:
**HAZOP Analysis and Acceptable Risk**

HAZOP (Hazard and Operability) analysis, a structured risk identification method, effectively identifies potential hazards in the systems and operations within process industries, enabling risk assessment during both design and operational phases. The results of a HAZOP analysis primarily address two key areas:

Firstly, it identifies and evaluates potential hazardous events (such as fires, explosions, or toxic substance releases) that may occur during a process. Based on this evaluation, it proposes corresponding measures to reduce the likelihood of these events and mitigate the severity of their consequences.

Secondly, it meticulously records and categorizes identified potential hazards that deviate from the intended process design, along with their underlying causes and potential consequences. This comprehensive documentation serves as a crucial foundation for subsequent risk management strategies and decision-making processes.

Regarding acceptable risk, once HAZOP analysis has identified the hazards and potential accidents within a process, these risks must be thoroughly evaluated to determine whether they fall within an acceptable range.

The judgment of acceptable risk is typically based on several crucial factors:

1.  **Compliance with Regulations and Standards:** Risk assessment outcomes must adhere to national, industry, and local government safety production regulations, standards, and codes. Risks that do not meet these requirements necessitate control measures to bring them to an acceptable level.
2.  **Risk Probability and Consequence:** The risk level is determined by a comprehensive assessment of the probability of a hazardous event occurring and its potential consequences. Methods such as risk matrices or LOPA (Layer of Protection Analysis) are commonly employed for this analysis [20].
3.  **Economic and Technical Feasibility:** The technical viability and economic reasonableness of risk control measures are assessed. For certain risks, if control costs are prohibitive or technically challenging to implement, their acceptability may need to be reconsidered, or alternative solutions explored.
4.  **Public Acceptance:** For risks that could impact the general public, the public's perception and acceptance level of the risk must be taken into account.
5.  **Internal Corporate Standards:** Beyond external regulations, companies also establish their own internal risk acceptance criteria. These are often more stringent than external standards, ensuring the utmost safety of production processes.

HAZOP analysis itself does not directly establish acceptable risk thresholds; rather, it provides the tools for risk identification and assessment. The determination of acceptable risk is usually a collaborative decision made by the project team, safety experts, and management. This decision integrates various factors, including regulatory requirements, industry best practices, and internal corporate policies.

originContent: 液氮贮存及后备
tranlastedContent:
Liquid Nitrogen Storage and Backup

图 1: Liquid nitrogen storage container

Liquid nitrogen storage tanks, serving as the primary storage medium, are widely utilized in various cryogenic preservation applications, including cells, tissues, and biological samples [20]. These tanks are typically vacuum-insulated to minimize heat transfer and reduce liquid nitrogen evaporation. Tank sizes and types vary significantly, ranging from small laboratory containers to large industrial-grade tanks capable of storing thousands of liters of liquid nitrogen. When selecting a liquid nitrogen storage tank, factors such as sample volume, storage duration, frequency of use, and budget must be considered.

表 1: Comparison of Characteristics of Different Liquid Nitrogen Storage Tanks

| Characteristic     | Small Laboratory Tanks | Medium Research Tanks | Large Industrial Tanks |
| :----------------- | :--------------------- | :-------------------- | :--------------------- |
| Volume             | 2-50 Liters            | 50-500 Liters         | 500-Thousands of Liters |
| Evaporation Rate   | Low                    | Medium                | Extremely Low          |
| Portability        | High                   | Medium                | Low                    |
| Cost               | Low                    | Medium                | High                   |
| Applicable Scenarios | Small samples, short-term storage | Large samples, long-term storage | Bulk storage, central supply |

To ensure the continuous supply of liquid nitrogen, a backup system is typically established. Backup systems can take various forms, such as additional liquid nitrogen tanks, automatic switching valves, or remote monitoring systems. Extra tanks provide additional storage capacity to handle situations where the primary tank fails or runs out of liquid nitrogen. Automatic switching valves can automatically switch to a backup tank when the primary tank's liquid level falls below a preset threshold. Remote monitoring systems, on the other hand, allow operators to monitor liquid nitrogen levels in real-time and perform remote control when necessary. When designing and implementing a backup system, it is crucial to consider the system's complexity, reliability, and cost-effectiveness. Regular inspection and maintenance of the backup system are also vital to ensure it functions correctly when needed.

originContent: 成本科目
tranlastedContent:
Cost Accounts

In traditional biological research, scientists typically rely on in vivo experiments (within live organisms) or in vitro cell experiments (outside the body), but these methods come with several limitations. While in vivo experiments can simulate complex biological environments, they are costly, time-consuming, and raise ethical concerns. More importantly, they make it difficult to achieve precise control over specific factors and perform high-throughput screening [20]. In vitro cell experiments, on the other hand, are relatively simple and easy to conduct, but their two-dimensional culture environment differs significantly from the complex tissue structures and cell-cell interactions found in the body, leading to a lower translation rate of experimental findings [21]. To overcome these limitations, three-dimensional (3D) cell culture technology emerged. By mimicking the in vivo microenvironment, this technology allows cells to grow in 3D structures, thereby more accurately reflecting physiological and pathological processes [22].

In recent years, organoids, an advanced 3D cell culture technology, have garnered widespread attention. Organoids are 3D structures that self-assemble from stem cells or progenitor cells in vitro. They can mimic the tissue architecture and functional characteristics of in vivo organs, exhibiting features such as multiple differentiated cell types, polarized structures, and partial organ functions [23, 24]. Leveraging these unique advantages, organoid technology shows immense potential in fields such as disease modeling, drug screening, regenerative medicine, and personalized therapy. For instance, in cancer research, scientists can utilize patient-derived tumor organoid models to conduct drug sensitivity tests, thereby providing more precise treatment plans for patients.

As organoid technology finds broad application in biomedical research, performing accurate and efficient morphological and functional analyses of organoids becomes particularly crucial. Traditional organoid analysis methods often involve time-consuming manual microscopic observation and qualitative assessment, which are not only inefficient but also susceptible to subjective factors, leading to poor reproducibility and reliability of results [25]. To address these challenges, researchers have begun exploring the use of artificial intelligence (AI) technologies, particularly machine learning and deep learning algorithms, to assist in organoid analysis. AI can process large amounts of image data and complex data patterns, enabling automated identification, classification, and quantitative analysis of organoid morphological features, as well as prediction of functional states, thereby significantly enhancing research efficiency and the objectivity of data analysis.
